meanings.sent1: The tree was very high, reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The airplane flew high above the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The high mountain seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were high as she climbed the tall ladder of success.
meanings.sent5: The high tower stood proudly against the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The high shelf was out of reach for the little girl.
meanings.sent2: The painting hung high on the museum wall.
meanings.sent3: The high chair made the toddler feel like a king at the table.
meanings.sent4: His high status in the company gave him authority.
meanings.sent5: The high throne overlooked the grand hall.

meanings.definition: Having a great or considerable extent or reach upward.
meanings.sent1: The high building towered over the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The kite flew high in the windy sky.
meanings.sent3: The high flagpole made the flag look like a tiny dot.
meanings.sent4: Her high jump broke the school record.
meanings.sent5: The high waterfall cascaded down the cliff.

meanings.sent1: The high fence kept the dogs from jumping over.
meanings.sent2: The high waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The high wall blocked their view of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His high score in the game impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The high ceiling made the room feel spacious.
